comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 10.-- Roy L. Shattuck of Brazil, Ind., Republican, who opposed Congressman Ralph W. Moss for re-election in 1914 and the four Republican candidates for Vigo county offices in 1914, who were arrested on Federal indictments today, will be arraigned before United States District Judge A.B. Anderson here on February 25. Source: Los Angeles Times

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an entry for Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Lloyd_Shattuck

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Arraigned February 25, 1915, died August 15, 1915? I can't find any news item from August 1915, but it seems there's still a piece of the puzzle missing.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: trialsanderrors and Richard Arthur Norton: Thanks for looking into Roy Shattuck. I checked Chronicling America: chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/ and the Proquest historical newspapers subscription databases but could not find out too much more. According to the Phildelphia Public Ledger (Feb. 25, 1915) Roy Shattuck pleaded not guilty to charges that he conspired with other unsuccessful candidates to corrupt the elections. The Baltimore Sun (April 13, 1915) reported that some those accused of corruption received prison sentences, but some were given suspended sentences as they had agreed to testify in the trial of Roy Shattuck. The Ogden (Utah) Standard (Nov. 30, 1915) reports four of the indicted who were going to testify against Shattuck in his trial, had now received their jail sentences because "Shattuck since has died".
